TEXT: The applicants , PERSON and PERSON are NORP nationals , who were born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE and PERSON . They were represented before the ORG by Mr A. The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
In DATE the applicants concluded a sales contract with the A. company in respect of real estate situated in GPE .
On DATE the applicants requested to be entered in the land register as owners .
On DATE bankruptcy proceedings were opened as regards the A. company .
On DATE ORG ( Bezirksgericht ) ordered the entry of the applicants as owners in the land register . Consequently , the applicants were entered in the land register .

On DATE the ORG ( PERSON ) quashed this decision upon the appeal of the A. company 's bankruptcy trustee . It noted that a chair lift was situated on the real estate . It therefore qualified as a railway facility within the meaning of LAW of LAW ( Eisenbahngesetz ) and no entry could be made in the land register until the sales contract had been approved by the competent authority under LAW . The applicants did not appeal to ORG against this decision .
Thereupon , on DATE ORG amended the land register , cancelling the entry of the applicants as owners .
On DATE the A. company , represented by its bankruptcy trustee , requested ORG ( ORG ) to approve the sales contract .

On DATE ORG refused the request , finding that due to the sales contract the ORG company could no longer fulfil the legal obligations resulting from its licence to run the chair lift on the real estate at issue . Therefore , the transaction ran counter to the public interest . This decision was served on the A. company but , erroneously , not on the applicants . On DATE the A. company filed an appeal .
On DATE the Federal Minister of ORG ( FAC öffentliche ORG ) dismissed the ORG company 's appeal . This decision was served on the applicants .
Subsequently , on DATE , the applicants filed a complaint with ORG ( Verwaltungsgerichtshof ) . In these and the subsequent proceedings the applicants were represented by counsel .
On DATE ORG rejected the applicants ' complaint . It noted that the applicants had not appealed against ORG decision of DATE and had therefore not exhausted available remedies .
On DATE the second applicant requested ORG to approve the sales contract .
On DATE the ORG dismissed the second applicant 's request .
On DATE the Federal Minister for Science , Traffic and Art ( ORG , ORG ) rejected the second applicant 's appeal . Subsequently , the latter lodged a complaint with ORG .
On DATE ORG refused to deal with the second applicant 's complaint for lack of prospects of success and transmitted the case to ORG .
On DATE the second applicant supplemented his complaint to ORG .
On DATE ORG instituted preliminary proceedings .

On DATE ORG dismissed the second applicant 's complaint . Noting that the Regional Governor 's decision of DATE had become binding in respect of the A. company , it found that a separate request for approval of the sales contract by the second applicant did not justify a review of the case . However , according to the relevant provision of ORG ( see domestic law part below ) , the second applicant had been party to the above proceedings . He had been “ omitted ” in the proceedings , as the Regional Governor 's decision had not been served on him . In accordance with the relevant case - law , it was up to him to request that a copy of that decision be served on him , so as to enable him to file an appeal against it .
On DATE , upon the applicants ' requests made in DATE , they were served the Regional Governor 's decision of DATE .

On DATE ORG quashed the Federal Minister 's decision of DATE . It noted , in particular , that the Minister had wrongly applied LAW of LAW . The transaction did not run counter to public interest as the bankruptcy trustee of the A. company had returned the licence for operating the chair lift in DATE and the real estate at issue did therefore no longer qualify as a railway facility .

On DATE the ORG dismissed the applicants ' appeal . It noted that the sales contract had not been approved under LAW before the expiry of the validity of the rank of creditors in the bankruptcy proceedings concerning the A. company . Therefore , the real estate at issue had fallen into the bankrupt 's assets and had been sold by the bankruptcy trustee .
On DATE ( served on DATE ) ORG rejected the applicants ' extraordinary appeal on points of law .
CARDINAL . Under LAW ( Allgemeines Bürgerliches Gesetzbuch ) the procedure for the acquisition of real property is the entry of the acquisition title in the land register ( see also LAW ) .
Under LAW can not proceed to enter a transaction in the land register until the transaction which is subject to approval has been approved by the competent authority .

CARDINAL . NORP Under the LAW and CARDINAL of LAW ( Eisenbahngesetz ) as in force at the relevant time , a sales contract concerning a train , a railway or real property qualified as railway facility was subject to approval by the competent authority . A sales contract without this approval was null and void ( § CARDINAL ) .
CARDINAL . The procedure concerning the approval was governed by LAW DATE ( Allgemeines Verwaltungsverfahrens - gesetz ) , section CARDINAL of which reads as follows :
" Persons who ... take part in the proceedings on the basis of a right granted to them or an interest protected by the law ... are parties [ to the proceedings ] . "
According to the case - law of ORG a person is regarded as a party whenever an administrative measure has a direct bearing on his or her personal rights .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of LAW provides that decisions of administrative authorities can be issued either by oral announcement or in a written form . According to the constant doctrine and the case - law of ORG , a decision of an administrative authority does not produce any legal effects on a party to which it had not been notified ( see PERSON , ORG , third edition , pp . CARDINAL , CARDINAL , with reference to ORG GPE CARDINALA/CARDINAL , DATE , CARDINAL , CARDINALA/CARDINAL , CARDINAL and GPE , DATE ORG ) . An “ omitted party ” ( übergangene ORG ) can , therefore , in principle not take any legal remedies against the decision at issue . This party can , however , request a declaratory decision concerning its standing as a party in the proceedings at issue or request the service of the decision and file an appeal once the decision had been served upon it . ( see ORG , PERSON , cited above , p. CARDINAL with reference to ORG FAC ) .

CARDINAL . By virtue of LAW ( Bundesverfassungsgesetz ) , ORG has jurisdiction to hear , inter alia , applications alleging that an administrative decision is unlawful . Pursuant to LAW the application may be brought by any person claiming a violation of his or her rights by the administrative decision , provided that this person has exhausted all other remedies .
